People of color report widespread racism in EU

The European Union has little ground for finger-pointing when it comes to racism. EU countries are by no means free of discrimination and violence — and calls for change are growing louder.  Go to article

Link: /en/as-media-watch-us-uprisings-eu-has-a-racism-problem-too/a-53780013

Racism in Germany 'an issue for society as a whole'

DW spoke to Dr. Karamba Diaby, Germany's first African-born black MP, about the global anti-racism protests and related developments in Germany. "Unfortunately, much needs to be done," the parliamentarian tells DW.  

Link: /en/racism-in-germany-an-issue-for-society-as-a-whole/a-53787641

Germany to launch study into police racism

The German government will look into the alleged "racial profiling" after a senior lawmaker claimed "latent racism" in the ranks of the German police. Other officials warned against equating Germany and the US.  

Link: /en/germany-to-launch-study-probing-racism-among-police/a-53779238

'If you're silent, you're against us'

The US national team goalkeeper, currently on loan at Düsseldorf, has had enough of police brutality and racism.  

Link: /en/usa-goalkeeper-zack-steffen-on-black-lives-matter-if-youre-silent-youre-against-us/a-53785020

Child laborers caught between coronavirus and economic hardship

In South Asian nations like Pakistan, where child labor is rampant, COVID-19 has brought more hardship to underage workers. Meanwhile, the resulting economic crisis is pushing even more children into child labor.  

Link: /en/child-laborers-caught-between-coronavirus-and-economic-hardship/a-53779040

The South Asian country has recorded almost 300,000 infections, behind only the US, Brazil and Russia. Meanwhile, the UN has warned the pandemic could cause a spike in child labor. Follow DW for the latest.

Turkey decries Germany's extended warning

Ankara is frustrated that Germany has failed to lift its coronavirus travel warning for Turkey, just as borders within the European Union start to reopen. Berlin stretched warnings for over 160 countries on Wednesday.  

Link: /en/turkey-decries-germanys-decision-to-keep-travel-warning/a-53784029

On June 15, Germany's travel warning for most European countries will be lifted. But how willing are Germans to travel?

Does coronavirus kill fewer people in East Asia?

People in East Asia seem to be less likely than those in many other parts of the world to die of the coronavirus. But the explanations that have been put forward do not all hold water, as Martin Fritz reports from Tokyo.  

Health budgets: Will the pandemic change Kenya's priorities?

Health is seen as one of the winners in Kenya's annual budget. Many in Kenya's health circles however argue that the COVID-19 crisis has simply highlighted the underfunding of the sector in past years.  

Link: /en/health-budgets-will-the-pandemic-change-kenyas-priorities/a-53779046

A devil's bargain for Dutch sex workers

Public health measures to curb the spread of the coronavirus have hit the Dutch domestic sex industry hard. Some of Amsterdam's sex workers continue to work illegally, risking their health to make ends meet.  

Link: /en/coronavirus-a-devils-bargain-for-dutch-sex-workers/a-53744562

The UK will not ask for more time to reach a deal with the EU on their post-Brexit relationship, the UK's top Brexit official Michael Gove has confirmed. However, the UK also softened its stance on border checks.

A chokehold ban planned by France's interior minister has prompted nationwide police protests. Officers in Paris downed handcuffs and displayed a banner declaring "no police, no peace."  

Link: /en/france-police-protest-against-chokehold-ban-racism-accusations/a-53786088

Rescue operations have recovered 53 bodies after a vessel carrying migrants capsized off the coast of Tunisia. The passengers had been fleeing tensions caused by the conflict in Libya.  

Link: /en/at-least-53-dead-in-migrant-shipwreck-off-tunisia/a-53785022

The Trump administration has sanctioned International Criminal Court employees investigating whether US troops committed war crimes in Afghanistan. The ICC accused the US of trying to "interfere with the rule of law."  

Link: /en/icc-slams-us-sanctions-over-afghanistan-war-crimes-probe/a-53780597

An "autonomous" protest camp in Seattle has stoked a verbal battle between the city and US President Donald Trump, who has threatened to send in the military. Mayor Jenny Durkan told him to "go back to your bunker."  

Link: /en/trump-feud-escalates-over-seattle-police-free-protest-zone/a-53782580

Twitter removes accounts linked to China, Russia 16h ago

Twitter said the accounts were part of a network used to push propaganda, attack critics of the government and spread misinformation. A majority of the accounts were linked to China.  

Link: /en/twitter-removes-state-linked-accounts-used-by-china-russia-and-turkey/a-53780815
